intro: Eremopoa mardinensis, commonly known as the Mardin eremopoa, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
